nodes.bodyText: I would prefer use "GlossaryTerm" and remove these conditionals.
The Subject Area API does not expose a concept called GlossaryTerm, only Term. I know it is easier internally as it matches the types.

I think if we leave GlossaryTerm here, it won't hurt anyone) or it is worth considering revising domain names to map to internal types, as is done with Line
And that help to us in future.
this code no longer exists
I am alarmed by the use of this service here...

I am alarmed by the use of this service here...

yes good spot - I guess this implies that we need access to the archive in the client libraries. That is a shame as it saves a lot of code.  I might try to generate some code from the archive so we do not have this dependancy.
@davidradl I really dont know how better resolve this problem but it is problem...
@immmus I have resolved the problem by hard coding the values in the Line children - similar to the way the code originally was but in the new structure. The code is ready for a new review now.

Just as a FYI I checked the dependency tree and it's not too bad as this is plain java code:
org.odpi.egeria:subject-area-api:jar:2.3-SNAPSHOT
 [INFO] +- org.odpi.egeria:open-metadata-types:jar:2.3-SNAPSHOT:compile
 [INFO] |  \- org.odpi.egeria:repository-services-archive-utilities:jar:2.3-SNAPSHOT:compile
 [INFO] |     +- org.odpi.egeria:open-metadata-archive-file-connector:jar:2.3-SNAPSHOT:compile
 [INFO] |     \- commons-io:commons-io:jar:2.7:compile

It's a 200k jar though it's dependenceis (esp commons-io) adds more - but probably typical for any of our clients.
Which really leaves any broader design discussions .. I'm less concerned with the inclusion per se?

May be make Line as abstract and make these methods abstract?

May be make Line as abstract and make these methods abstract?

I had a play with this idea, the OmrsLine extends from Line and would need implementations of these methods that does not make sense for it. I have left this as is - as I do not want to change this without thinking it through in more detail what is required for OMRSLine.

May be make Line as abstract and make these methods abstract?

I had a play with this idea, the OmrsLine extends from Line and would need implementations of these methods that does not make sense for it. I have left this as is - as I do not want to change this without thinking it through in more detail what is required for OMRSLine.

When do you want to think about it? I'm afraid this will remain so and in the future you can bring us trouble.

OMRSLine

It turned out to be straight forward, this OMRSLine was not used in the code so I have deleted and made the methods abstract. Thanks @immmus
